Speech Mario Draghi: The euro area economy - current prospects and challenges ahead http://t.co/SRL6rAw9Z9
Draghi: Euro area has a strategy to return to sustainable growth and employment and that strategy is being executed.
Draghi: Average Core Tier 1 ratio of the largest euro area banks currently stands well above 11%. Majority already complies with Basel III.
Draghi: Euro area countries have cut fiscal deficit ratios by half since 2009 and are expected to run a small primary surplus by year-end
Draghi: Governments are tackling imbalances and implementing reforms to reverse misguided past policies and create sustainable growth
Draghi: We have to ensure that interest rate expectations stay firmly anchored around path that does not add to downside risks to recovery.
Draghi: Monetary accommodation can accompany and facilitate a regime shift in economic policy. But we know it can never replace it.
Draghi: But preserving monetary accommodation is a necessary but not sufficient condition for the recovery to take hold
Draghi: Our monetary policy will accompany euro area's reform process by maintaining the degree of accommodation that is most appropriate

Cœuré: Overreliance on central bank funding, including ELA, can delay restructuring, changes in banks business models http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut

Cœuré:  Resort to central bank liquidity should be expensive, bound in
time, and address only emergency situations http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut
Cœuré:  New requirements will provide better monitoring and limit the social cost of liquidity crises http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut
Cœuré: Regulation might make fragile banks rely more on the Eurosystem, which risks becoming lender of first resort http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut

Cœuré:  The regulation aims at reducing banks’ undue reliance on
central bank liquidity http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut
Cœuré: Liquidity ought to be provided to banking system as needed but it should not be substitute for lack of capital http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut

Cœuré:  Need strong banking supervision, free of national political
influence http://t.co/M3FXVI0Dut
